name: Meat Stew
ingredients: 1 kg ground beef (chicken or turkey can also be options)
1 russet potato (sweet potato, yam, and yacon potato can also be options, chopped)
1 medium carrot or pumpkin (cut into cubes)
methodOfPreparation: Sauté the meat in a large pot until it is no longer pink. Do not drain the fat, as it is good fat for the pet. If you opted for a leaner meat (like chicken or turkey), add a few tablespoons of coconut oil to acquire a bit more fat.
Add the potato, carrot, and green beans.
Add enough water to cover the vegetables.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for about 20 minutes (or until the vegetables are cooked).
You can add a pinch of sea salt for extra flavor.
Allow to cool before serving. Refrigerate or freeze any leftovers.
This recipe can vary, aiming to offer diversified nutrients as proposed in the mentioned ingredients above.

name: Festive Rice
ingredients: 2 kg ground turkey or chicken breast
methodOfPreparation: In a large saucepan, bring 3 cups of water to a boil, cook the rice according to package instructions, and set aside.
Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add the ground turkey or chicken and cook until browned (about 3-5 minutes).
Be sure to break up the meat well while cooking.
Stir in the spinach, carrots, zucchini, peas, and brown rice until the spinach wilts and the mixture is heated through, about 3 to 5 minutes.
Allow to cool completely.

name: Canine Pumpkin Biscuit
ingredients: ⅔ cup pumpkin puree (preferably neck or yellow pumpkin, as they are less watery)
2 cups whole grain brown rice flour
1 large egg (omit if your dog is allergic)
½ tablespoon flaxseed oil or olive oil
methodOfPreparation: Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F).
Use parchment paper on the baking sheet to prevent the biscuits from sticking.
Mix the beaten egg and pumpkin together in a separate bowl until smooth (if not using egg, simply smooth the pumpkin puree and proceed to the next step).
In a large bowl, mix the flaxseed oil and whole grain brown rice flour.
With constant stirring, add the pumpkin mixture to the rice mixture and slowly add the water.
Make sure to reserve a bit of rice to use as a sort of topping.
Mix the ingredients well.
Using two small spoons, place small portions onto the parchment paper.
Bake for 35 to 40 minutes, or until the tops are completely dry.
Allow to cool and store in a dry plastic or glass container until ready to serve.
This homemade dog food recipe yields approximately 24 biscuits.

name: Carrot Cupcake
ingredients: ¼ cup unsweetened, unsalted peanut butter
methodOfPreparation: Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F).
Mix the dry ingredients (flour and baking soda) in a bowl and set aside.
In another bowl, combine all the other ingredients until a homogeneous and well-mixed dough forms.
Gradually, to avoid clumps, add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients until everything is mixed.
Divide the batter into silicone cupcake molds and bake for approximately 20 minutes.
To check if they're ready, insert a wooden toothpick into a cupcake: if it comes out clean, without any raw batter, the cupcakes are done!
Allow to cool slightly and then remove from the molds.
If you like, you can decorate the cupcakes with a little of the same unsweetened, unsalted peanut butter and treats.
Your pet will love it, and there's a good chance you'll enjoy it too!

name: Strawberry Treat for Cats
methodOfPreparation: In a bowl, crack the egg and mix it with the oat flour.
Remove the stems from the strawberries and blend them with a hand mixer or blender until smooth.
Add the blended strawberries to the egg and oat mixture.
Pour the mixture into a greased baking sheet or cupcake molds.
Bake in an oven at 180°C (350°F) until golden brown.
If using a traditional rectangular pan, allow to cool and then break into small pieces before offering to the cat.

name: Coconut Treat for Dogs
methodOfPreparation: In a food processor, combine the coconut oil, peanut butter, and rolled oats.
Using a spoon, form small balls (if the mixture is too dry or too wet, simply add more oats or coconut oil to adjust).
Gently roll the balls in shredded coconut until completely coated.
Place on a container lined with parchment paper. Refrigerate for 1 hour before serving.
Transfer to plastic bags or airtight containers for storage. You can also freeze them to maintain their crunchiness.

name: Sweet Potato and Apple Muffin
methodOfPreparation: Start with the apple juice: peel two apples, remove the seeds, and cut into pieces.
Blend in a blender with a little water. Strain the juice through a sieve.
To make the sweet potato puree, peel the potatoes, cook them in water, and when soft, mash them with a fork.
Preheat the oven to 170°C (340°F) for 10 minutes. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Mix the sweet potato puree, oat flour, and cinnamon. Gradually add the apple juice until a homogeneous dough forms.
Using a teaspoon, divide the dough into balls and place on the baking sheet.
Bake for 10 to 15 minutes. Then, allow to cool and serve!

name: Banana and Carrot Cupcake
methodOfPreparation: Preheat the oven to 170°C (340°F) for 10 minutes.
Mix egg, banana, carrot, peanut butter, oil, and honey in a large bowl.
In another bowl, mix the flour, baking soda, and oat flour.
Combine the wet and dry ingredients in a single bowl.
Fill each cupcake liner and bake for 15 to 20 minutes.
Remove from the oven and let cool.
Unmold each cupcake and top with a dollop of peanut butter!

name: Chicken and Sweet Potato Sticks
methodOfPreparation: Clean the chicken breasts, removing any skin and fat.
Cut into thick strips.
Peel the sweet potatoes, cutting them into strips thinner than the chicken.
Preheat the oven to 120°C (250°F) for 10 minutes.
On a baking sheet lined with aluminum foil, place the chicken strips and then the sweet potato strips on top.
Bake for about 1 hour and 30 minutes. The ideal point is when the stick is very dry, like a stick snack.

name: Frozen Banana Yogurt
methodOfPreparation: Mix all ingredients in a blender, except water, and blend until smooth.
Add water gradually as needed to form a creamy mixture.
Pour the mixture into cupcake molds and freeze.
Before serving, remove from the freezer, unmold, and let it thaw slightly for a few minutes.

name: Strawberry Ice Cream
methodOfPreparation: Dice the fruit into small pieces, removing only the leaves.
Blend with water in a blender.
Pour into the ice cube tray and freeze. Once frozen, simply unmold and serve to your pet!

name: Homemade Seed Mix
methodOfPreparation: Mix all ingredients in a bowl.
Store in an airtight container.
Serve a small amount daily as needed.

name: Bird Biscuits
ingredients: ½ cup mixed seeds (sunflower, sesame, flax)
methodOfPreparation: Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F).
Mix all ingredients until a dough forms.
Roll out the dough on a floured surface and cut into small biscuits.
Place the biscuits on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
Bake for about 15-20 minutes or until golden brown.
Let cool before serving to the birds.

name: Fruit and Vegetable Mix
methodOfPreparation: Mix all ingredients in a bowl.
Serve in small quantities as a supplement to the regular seed diet.
Remove any uneaten leftovers at the end of the day to avoid fermentation and insect attraction.

name: Egg Mash
methodOfPreparation: Boil the egg until firm.
Let cool and remove the shell.
Mash the egg and mix with breadcrumbs and seeds.
Serve in small portions as a protein supplement.

name: Grain Salad
methodOfPreparation: Cook the rice, quinoa, and lentils separately according to package instructions.
Let cool.
Mix all ingredients in a bowl.
Serve in small quantities as a nutritious supplement.
